snippet: After months of attacking Hillary Rodham Clinton, the former  Hewlett-Packard executive began to gain traction as debate viewers saw her as singularly qualified to take on Donald J. Trump.
abstract: Republican presidential contender Carly Fiorina has gained attention by positioning herself as sole female in crowded primary field and one uniquely positioned to rebuff Donald Trump, whose bluster includes comments interpreted as sexist; Republicans are eyeing Fiorina as someone who could dispel GOP's boys-club image, as well as a credible challenger to Hillary Rodham Clinton.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and TRIP GABRIEL

lead_paragraph: After months of attacking Hillary Rodham Clinton, the former  Hewlett-Packard executive began to gain traction as debate viewers saw her as singularly qualified to take on Donald J. Trump.

headline.main: Carly Fiorina Emerges as a G.O.P. Weapon Against ‘War on Women’ Charge
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Remarks Pull Fiorina From Outer Reach of G.O.P. Pack
